title: malware
description: MMalware is a type of TTP that is also known as malicious code and malicious software, refers to a program that is inserted into a system, usually covertly, with the intent of compromising the confidentiality, integrity, or availability of the victim's data, applications, or operating system (OS) or of otherwise annoying or disrupting the victim.

type.description: The type of this object, which MUST be the literal `malware`.

labels.description: The type of malware being described. Open Vocab - malware-label-ov

name.description: The name used to identify the Malware.

description.description: Provides more context and details about the Malware object.

kill_chain_phases.description: The list of kill chain phases for which this Malware instance can be used.

..\\common\\core.json.title: core
..\\common\\core.json.description: Common properties and behavior across all STIX Domain Objects and STIX Relationship Objects.

type.title: type
type.description: The type property identifies the type of STIX Object (SDO, Relationship Object, etc). The value of the type field MUST be one of the types defined by a STIX Object (e.g., indicator).

id.description: The id property universally and uniquely identifies this object.

created_by_ref.description: The ID of the Source object that describes who created this object.

labels.description: The labels property specifies a set of classifications.

created.description: The created property represents the time at which the first version of this object was created.

modified.description: The modified property represents the time that this particular version of the object was created.

revoked.description: The revoked property indicates whether the object has been revoked.

external_references.description: A list of external references which refers to non-STIX information.

object_marking_refs.description: The list of marking-definition objects to be applied to this object.

granular_markings.description: The set of granular markings that apply to this object.

..\\common\\identifier.json.title: identifier
..\\common\\identifier.json.description: Represents identifiers across the CTI specifications. The format consists of the name of the top-level object being identified, followed by two dashes (--), followed by a UUIDv4.

..\\common\\timestamp.json.title: timestamp
..\\common\\timestamp.json.description: Represents timestamps across the CTI specifications. The format is an RFC3339 timestamp, with a required timezone specification of 'Z'.

..\\common\\external-reference.json.title: external-reference
..\\common\\external-reference.json.description: External references are used to describe pointers to information represented outside of STIX.

url.description: A URL reference to an external resource.

source_name.description: The source within which the external-reference is defined (system, registry, organization, etc.)

external_id.description: An identifier for the external reference content.

source_name.description: The source within which the external-reference is defined (system, registry, organization, etc.)

external_id.description: An identifier for the external reference content.

source_name.description: The source within which the external-reference is defined (system, registry, organization, etc.)

external_id.description: An identifier for the external reference content.

..\\common\\url-regex.json.title: url
..\\common\\url-regex.json.description: Matches the elements of a URL using a regular expression. Uses Diego Perini's regex from https://gist.github.com/dperini/729294.

..\\common\\granular-marking.json.title: granular-marking
..\\common\\granular-marking.json.description: The granular-marking type defines how the list of marking-definition objects referenced by the marking_refs property to apply to a set of content identified by the list of selectors in the selectors property.

selectors.description: A list of selectors for content contained within the STIX object in which this property appears.

marking_ref.description: The marking_ref property specifies the ID of the marking-definition object that describes the marking.

..\\common\\kill-chain-phase.json.title: kill-chain-phase
..\\common\\kill-chain-phase.json.description: The kill-chain-phase represents a phase in a kill chain.

kill_chain_name.description: The name of the kill chain.

phase_name.description: The name of the phase in the kill chain.
